qas.question: What capacities are passenger elevators availablee in?

answers.text: from 500 to 2,700 kg (1,000–6,000 lb) in 230 kg (500 lb) increments

qas.question: What types of passenger elevators are installed in structures of up to eight floors?
Hydraulic elevators can reach speeds up to 1m/s or how many feet per minute?
Electric elevators can reach speeds up to 3 m/s or how many feet per minute?

context: Passenger elevators capacity is related to <a0_0>the available floor space<a0_0/>. Generally passenger elevators are available in capacities <a1_0>from 500 to 2,700 kg (1,000–6,000 lb) in 230 kg (500 lb) increments<a1_0/>.[citation needed] Generally passenger elevators in buildings of eight floors or fewer are <a2_0>hydraulic or electric<a2_0/>, which can reach speeds up to 1 m/s (<a3_0>200<a3_0/> ft/min) hydraulic and up to 152 m/min (500 ft/min) electric. In buildings up to ten floors, electric and gearless elevators are likely to have speeds up to 3 m/s (<a4_0>500<a4_0/> ft/min), and above ten floors speeds range 3 to 10 m/s (500–2,000 ft/min).[citation needed]
